person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Kinshasa opposes airdrops , apparently because the food could fall into the hands of the rebels and their local supporters .

Let's think step by step.

The "Person" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Kinshasa (referring to the government of Kinshasa)
2. rebels
3. local supporters
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

Sure, my apologies. The "Person" entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to a person or group of people are:

1. rebels
2. local supporters

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid "Person" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table:

| Person |
| --- |
| rebels |
| local supporters |

location.content:

2. The location where the airdrops are planned to take place (implied, not explicitly mentioned)
3. The location where the rebels and their local supporters are based (implied, not explicitly mentioned)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Location.

Sure, here are the updated "Location" entities in the paragraph:

The other two locations are not explicitly mentioned and can be considered irrelevant in the context of the paragraph.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Kinshasa opposes airdrops , apparently because the food could fall into the hands of the rebels and their local supporters .

Let's think step by step.

The "Organization" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Kinshasa (opposes airdrops) - Kinshasa is the capital city of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and is considered an organization as it is a government entity.
2. Rebels (local supporters) - The rebels are an organization as they are a group of individuals working together to achieve a common goal, in this case, opposing the government.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.

Sure, my apologies for the mistake. Here are the relevant "Organization" entities in the paragraph:

1. Kinshasa (opposes airdrops) - Kinshasa is the capital city of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and is considered an organization as it is a government entity.

The rebels are not explicitly mentioned as an organization, so I will remove them from the list of organizations.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid "Organization" entities in the paragraph presented in a Markdown table:

| Organization |
| --- |
| Kinshasa |

Note: Kinshasa is the capital city of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and is considered an organization as it is a government entity.
